name: resynchronization

the act of making two things reach the same or a related stage at the same time again, or the act of two things reaching the same or a related stage at the same time again: This helps maintain resynchronization by forcing the pacemaker to pace the left ventricle whenever there is activity in the right ventricle. Periodic resynchronisation of a bitstream can be achieved by the insertion of explicit synchronization code words. See also
